item.title: Donald Trump Jr. Is Engaged to Bettina Anderson, a Palm Beach Socialite
item.description: The relationship between the president’s son and Ms. Anderson had been the subject of tabloid speculation during his previous engagement to Kimberly Guilfoyle.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron
item.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. and Bettina Anderson in Washington in June.

item.title: U.S. Strikes 3 More Boats in Eastern Pacific, Killing 8
item.description: The attacks brought the number killed since the Trump administration began the strikes on suspected drug smugglers to at least 95.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Willis
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: An image taken from video released on Monday by the U.S. Southern Command.

item.title: Kushner’s Firm Pulls Out of Trump-Branded Hotel Deal in Serbia
item.description: The announcement came just hours after prosecutors there charged four government officials with corruption in connection with the half-billion-dollar project.
item.dc:creator: Sharon LaFraniere and Lara Jakes
item.media:credit: Vladimir Zivojinovic for The New York Times
item.media:description: A real estate development project in Belgrade, Serbia, would have replaced bombed-out buildings with a luxury hotel bearing the Trump name.

item.title: Rob Reiner Is Said to Have Argued With His Son Nick at Conan O’Brien’s Holiday Party
item.description: Rob Reiner and his son, Nick, had a dispute at a party hosted by Conan O’Brien the night before the director and his wife were found dead.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler, Brooks Barnes and Jason Zinoman
item.media:description: Rob Reiner and Nick Reiner at an event in 2016.

item.title: Wisconsin Judge Allows Election Case to Proceed Against Trump Advisers
item.description: A judge ruled that at least two of three defendants would have to stand trial in a case stemming from a plan to deploy fake electors after Donald Trump lost the 2020 presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Danny Hakim
item.media:credit: Lauren Justice for The New York Times
item.media:description: Voting in Wisconsin in 2020. Wisconsin is one of five states that brought criminal charges related to the 2020 Trump campaign’s efforts to circumvent the outcome of the vote.

item.title: Other celebrities have died tragically in L.A.’s Brentwood neighborhood.
item.description: The wealthy enclave
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales
item.media:description: Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner had lived in their home in the Brentwood area of Los Angeles since 1991.

item.title: Trump Files $10 Billion Suit Over BBC Documentary
item.description: The British broadcaster, which has expressed regret over the editing of video clips about the president, has rejected claims that the error was evidence of a fundamental bias in its news reporting.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear
item.media:description: The BBC’s board chairman apologized in a letter to a British parliamentary committee, saying the documentary’s editing had been an “error of judgment.”

item.title: Pelosi Long Resisted Stock-Trading Ban for Congress, Fueling Suspicion
item.description: The former speaker failed to appreciate the groundswell of support for banning the practice, refusing to give an inch amid G.O.P. accusations that she was corrupt.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.media:description: Nancy Pelosi’s legacy as the first woman to lead the House will include her years of resistance on banning lawmakers’ stock trading. She now supports the idea.

item.title: FBI Director Kash Patel, Eager for Spotlight, Casts Aside Caution in Social Media Posts
item.description: Kash Patel’s impulse to publicize the work of the bureau under his leadership has revived questions about his competence and his future in the administration.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush and Devlin Barrett
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Even if Trump officials have privately criticized Mr. Patel, particularly over his use of government assets, rumors about his firing or forced resignation have yet to materialize.

item.title: Trial Opens for Judge Accused of Steering Immigrant Away from Federal Agents
item.description: “There was no corrupt intent,” the judge’s lawyer said in an opening statement. Prosecutors said the judge’s political views made her “cross the line.”
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman
item.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan outside the federal courthouse in Milwaukee on Monday.

item.title: How the Winklevoss Twins Won Big in Trump’s Pro-Crypto Washington
item.description: Few industry players seem closer to Trump than the 44-year-old billionaire brothers. And they have gotten more than just invitations to the White House this year.
item.dc:creator: Sharon LaFraniere
item.media:description: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss at the White House.

item.title: Rob and Nick Reiner Made a Movie About a Turbulent Father-Son Relationship
item.description: Nick Reiner, who struggled with drug addiction, wrote “Being Charlie” during a period of sobriety. His father directed the film.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik
item.media:description: Rob and Nick Reiner speaking about their film “Being Charlie” in New York in 2016.

item.title: The shootings at Brown and in Sydney were a ‘gut punch’ for Providence’s Jewish community.
item.dc:creator: Talya Minsberg
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Flowers left on the campus of Brown University.

item.title: Harvard’s President Will Stay in the Role Indefinitely
item.description: Alan M. Garber was appointed after his predecessor resigned under pressure. He has been in the role as Harvard fended off challenges from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Vimal Patel
item.media:description: Harvard’s president, Alan M. Garber, at the college’s commencement in May.

item.title: Heng Guan Documented China’s Detention of Uyghurs. The U.S. Wants to Deport Him.
item.description: Heng Guan fled to the United States and released rare video evidence of China’s clampdown. His supporters say that sending him to Uganda puts him at risk.
item.dc:creator: Amy Qin and Chris Buckley

item.title: What Does It Mean to Be a ‘Person of Interest’?
item.description: Police officers investigating the Brown University shooting released a man they called a “person of interest.” Officials defended the twist in the case as the normal course of policing.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Dewan
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: On Sunday morning in Providence, R.I., the police had detained a “person of interest” in connection to the shooting at Brown University. By late evening, they backpedaled.

item.title: Here Are the Only Known Videos of the Possible Brown University Gunman
item.description: The clips were captured on Saturday and show a man walking on sidewalks near the Brown campus after the shooting.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

item.title: Justice Dept. Charges Four in Los Angeles Over Left-Wing Bomb Plot
item.description: Administration officials said the case grew out of a presidential order declaring antifa to be a terrorist group.
item.dc:creator: Devlin Barrett
item.media:description: Bill Essayli, picked by President Trump to run the U.S. attorney’s office in Los Angeles, argued that the case should dispel any skepticism toward the administration’s claims about the danger of violence from the left.

item.title: Democrats Celebrate Rob Reiner as a Hands-On Political Activist
item.description: The Hollywood star was an unusually hands-on activist and donor, whose deep understanding of politics set him apart from other celebrities.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck and Adam Nagourney
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.media:description: Rob Reiner and Hillary Clinton in 2008. Mr. Reiner’s political activism spanned the local, state and national levels.

item.title: Trump Administration Begins Program to Increase Government’s Tech Worker Ranks
item.description: The U.S. Tech Force is aiming to hire about 1,000 top-level technical employees and supervisors to join federal agencies and work on projects related to artificial intelligence and modernization.
item.dc:creator: Eileen Sullivan
item.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
item.media:description: Scott Kupor is the director of the Office of Personnel Management, which is leading the program.

item.title: Trump’s Post Attacking Rob Reiner After Stabbing Death Draws Immediate Outrage
item.description: The president attributed the killing to “Trump derangement syndrome,” but his disparaging comments drew backlash even from conservative allies who said they were inappropriate.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater
item.media:description: Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, at the Kennedy Center in Washington in 2023. The Reiners’ 32-year-old son was “booked for murder,” according to the Los Angeles police chief, Jim McDonnell.

item.title: Harvard, Yale and Other Universities Boost Security After Brown Shooting
item.description: A gunman who killed two students at Brown University is still at large. There were no specific threats against other schools, but many are taking precautions.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Mervosh
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Brown University canceled exams and sent students home after a shooting in a study session on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Ella Cook, Victim of Shooting at Brown University, Is Remembered as ‘a Bright Light’
item.description: Ella Cook, a 19-year-old sophomore from Mountain Brook, Ala., was a gifted pianist and spoke fluent French, a classmate said.
item.dc:creator: Jenna Russell and Lauren McCarthy
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Flowers outside the Barus and Holley Building on the Brown University campus in Providence, R.I., on Sunday.

item.title: U.S. Soldiers and Translator Killed in Syria Are Identified
item.description: The shooting attack in Palmyra, Syria, on Saturday struck Iowa National Guard troops. Two were killed, along with an American civilian interpreter; three others were wounded.
item.dc:creator: Ann Hinga Klein, Sonia A. Rao and Christina Morales
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: MukhammadAziz Umurzokov, Killed in the Brown Shooting, Is Remembered as a Scholar
item.description: MukhammadAziz Umurzokov, 18, was gentle and extroverted, his sisters and a friend said, and had dreams of becoming a neurosurgeon.
item.dc:creator: Rich Griset, Eduardo Medina and Emily Cochrane
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Flowers were left as part of a memorial on the campus of Brown University.

item.title: Nick Reiner Talked Openly About His Struggles
item.description: He and his father, the director Rob Reiner, also worked together on a film that was loosely inspired by the son’s early life.
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins
item.media:description: Nick Reiner in 2016. He was arrested late Sunday after his parents, the director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, were found dead at their California home.

item.title: Jamie Lee Curtis and Other Celebrities Pay Tribute to Rob Reiner
item.description: Stars of Mr. Reiner’s movies, as well as celebrities who simply admired his work, have posted heartfelt tributes to the director on social media.
item.dc:creator: Alex Marshall
item.media:description: Rob Reiner at the Los Angeles premiere of “Spinal Tap II: The End Continues” in September.

item.title: Michele Singer Reiner Inspired Rob Reiner to Change the Ending of ‘When Harry Met Sally’
item.description: Mr. Reiner’s falling for his wife of 36 years inspired the director to rework the ending of “When Harry Met Sally …” The couple would collaborate on movies and political causes.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam and Alex Marshall
item.media:description: Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner in Los Angeles in 2019. The couple had been married over three decades when they were found dead in their home on Sunday.

item.title: Officials Renew Search for Brown University Shooter After Releasing Person of Interest
item.description: Hours after announcing they had detained a person in connection with the deadly shooting at Brown University, officials appealed to the public for new leads.
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins
item.media:description: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence speaking at Lippitt Memorial Park on Sunday during a candlelight vigil for the victims of a shooting at Brown University.

item.title: Trial Starts for Judge Accused of Helping Undocumented Immigrant Evade Agents
item.description: The Milwaukee County judge faces federal charges, but she has maintained her innocence.
item.dc:creator: Julie Bosman and Dan Simmons
item.media:credit: Jovanny Hernandez/Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, via USA TODAY NETWORK, via Imagn Images
item.media:description: Judge Hannah C. Dugan leaving a courthouse in Milwaukee in November.

item.title: Trump’s Diversity Rollback Ends Crucial Aid for Deafblind Children Like Annie Garner
item.description: A program for deafblind children helped 3-year-old Annie Garner, born with poor vision and no ears, learn to communicate. The Trump administration cut the program’s funding over diversity goals.
item.dc:creator: Sonia A. Rao and Jamie Kelter Davis
item.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
item.media:description: Casey and Leah Garner with their daughter, Annie, at their home in Reedsburg, Wis.

item.title: Rob Reiner and Wife Found Stabbed to Death: What We Know
item.description: The director’s family said that Mr. Reiner and his wife, Michele, died on Sunday. Their son Nick Reiner was arrested on suspicion of murder, police said.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young
item.media:description: Police officers outside the home of Rob Reiner in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles on Sunday night.

item.title: Democratic leaders mourn Reiner, a champion of liberal causes.
item.dc:creator: Shashank Bengali and Jill Cowan
item.media:description: Rob Reiner in 2012. He helped overturn Proposition 8, California’s ban on gay marriage.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault, Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Jacey Fortin and Mitch Smith

item.title: Brentwood, where the Reiners lived, is a wealthy enclave popular with celebrities.
item.dc:creator: Jill Cowan
item.media:description: Reporters gathering near Rob Reiner’s residence in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles on Sunday.
